Dataset: Two datasets: 15,153 images (Dataset 1), 4,575 images (Dataset 2). Balanced subsets created.
Methodology: Transfer learning applied to VGG16 and Inception ResNet. Custom CNN trained using 80:10:10 cross-validation. Grad-CAM used for visualization.

Dataset: COVID-19 (3,615), Lung Opacity (6,012), Pneumonia (5,870), Lung Cancer (20,000), Tuberculosis (1,400), Normal (10,192).
Methodology: Pretrained VGG19 followed by CNN for feature extraction. Full dataset normalized and resized. Random splitting for training.

Dataset: NIH Dataset (Normal, Pneumonia, Pneumothorax) + Cheonan Soonchunhyang University dataset (Tuberculosis).
Methodology: Preprocessing with Center Crop, fine-tuning of ImageNet weights, and Multi GAP structure. NIH dataset benchmarked; four-class prediction used for hospital dataset.
Models evaluated on preprocessed and augmented data using cross-validation. Custom model optimized for low-cost computation and higher precision metrics.
Fine-tuned MobileLungNetV2 on preprocessed images (CLAHE for contrast enhancement, Gaussian filter for denoising). Grad-CAM used for heatmaps.

Dataset: NIH Dataset (Normal, Pneumonia, Pneumothorax) + Cheonan Soonchunhyang University Hospital dataset.
Methodology: End-to-end transfer learning using raw CXR images directly in a one-step process. Classifying 3 classes on NIH and 4 on SCH dataset.

Dataset: 5928 CXR images sourced from various open-access websites: COVID-19 (1626), Normal (1802), Pneumonia (1800), Tuberculosis (700)
Methodology: Resizing, Gaussian filter for noise removal, CLAHE for image enhancement, and data augmentation to increase dataset size.

Dataset: Publicly available datasets with 7,132 chest X-ray images (COVID-19, Pneumonia, Tuberculosis).
All Models Used: Convolution Features, Explainable AI Framework (Grad-CAM, SHAP, LIME).
Methodology: Deep learning with XAI models for feature extraction and interpretability. Gradient-weighted Class Activation Mapping (Grad-CAM), LIME, and SHAP methods applied.

Dataset: Publicly available CT and X-Ray datasets.
Methodology: Proposed new image enhancement model based on k-symbol Lerch transcendent functions in pre-processing. Customized CNN and pre-trained AlexNet, VGG16 applied for classification.

All Models Used: CNN, Hybrid Models, Ensembles, Transformers, Big Transfer, Xception (fine-tuned).
Methodology: Hyperparameter tuning, stratified k-fold cross-validation (5-fold), transfer learning, explainable AI (XAI) for model interpretability and decision-making trust.

All Models Used: 2D CNN, AdaBoost, SVM, Random Forest, Backpropagation Neural Network, DNN
Methodology: Hybrid deep learning framework using CNN for feature extraction. Applied machine learning classifiers such as SVM, Random Forest, and DNN for classification.

Dataset: NIH Chest X-ray dataset with 14 classes; synthetic dataset generated using GAN containing 1193 samples for five classes.
All Models Used: MobileNet, DenseNet, VGG-16, EfficientNet, Xception, InceptionV3, Deep-CNN, R-CNN, GAN.
Methodology: Experimentation with various models and optimization. Evaluation using recall, precision, F1-score, binary accuracy, and AUC.
